verses.text: Hear, O Israel: Thou art to pass over Jordan \add this\add* day, to go in to possess nations greater and mightier than thyself, cities great and fenced up to heaven,
a people great and tall, the children of the Anakims, whom thou knowest, and \add of whom\add* thou hast heard \add say\add*, Who can stand before the children of Anak!

Understand therefore \add this\add* day, that the \sc Lord\sc* thy God \add is\add* he which goeth over before thee; \add as\add* a consuming fire he shall destroy them, and he shall bring them down before thy face: so shalt thou drive them out, and destroy them quickly, as the \sc Lord\sc* hath said unto thee.

Speak not thou in thine heart, after that the \sc Lord\sc* thy God hath cast them out from before thee, saying, For my righteousness the \sc Lord\sc* hath brought me in to possess this land: but for the wickedness of these nations the \sc Lord\sc* doth drive them out from before thee.

Not for thy righteousness, or for the uprightness of thine heart, dost thou go to possess their land: but for the wickedness of these nations the \sc Lord\sc* thy God doth drive them out from before thee, and that he may perform the word which the \sc Lord\sc* sware unto thy fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
Understand therefore, that the \sc Lord\sc* thy God giveth thee not this good land to possess it for thy righteousness; for thou \add art\add* a stiffnecked people.

Remember, \add and\add* forget not, how thou provokedst the \sc Lord\sc* thy God to wrath in the wilderness: from the day that thou didst depart out of the land of Egypt, until ye came unto this place, ye have been rebellious against the \sc Lord\sc*.
Also in Horeb ye provoked the \sc Lord\sc* to wrath, so that the \sc Lord\sc* was angry with you to have destroyed you.

When I was gone up into the mount to receive the tables of stone, \add even\add* the tables of the covenant which the \sc Lord\sc* made with you, then I abode in the mount forty days and forty nights, I neither did eat bread nor drink water:

and the \sc Lord\sc* delivered unto me two tables of stone written with the finger of God; and on them \add was written\add* according to all the words, which the \sc Lord\sc* spake with you in the mount out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly.
And it came to pass at the end of forty days and forty nights, \add that\add* the \sc Lord\sc* gave me the two tables of stone, \add even\add* the tables of the covenant.

And the \sc Lord\sc* said unto me, Arise, get thee down quickly from hence; for thy people which thou hast brought forth out of Egypt have corrupted \add themselves;\add* they are quickly turned aside out of the way which I commanded them; they have made them a molten image.
Furthermore the \sc Lord\sc* spake unto me, saying, I have seen this people, and behold, it \add is\add* a stiffnecked people:
let me alone, that I may destroy them, and blot out their name from under heaven: and I will make of thee a nation mightier and greater than they.
So I turned and came down from the mount, and the mount burned with fire: and the two tables of the covenant \add were\add* in my two hands.

And I looked, and behold, ye had sinned against the \sc Lord\sc* your God, \add and\add* had made you a molten calf: ye had turned aside quickly out of the way which the \sc Lord\sc* had commanded you.
And I took the two tables, and cast them out of my two hands, and brake them before your eyes.

And I fell down before the \sc Lord\sc*, as at the first, forty days and forty nights: I did neither eat bread, nor drink water, because of all your sins which ye sinned, in doing wickedly in the sight of the \sc Lord\sc*, to provoke him to anger.
For I was afraid of the anger and hot displeasure, where\add with\add* the \sc Lord\sc* was wroth against you to destroy you. But the \sc Lord\sc* hearkened unto me at that time also.
And the \sc Lord\sc* was very angry with Aaron to have destroyed him: and I prayed for Aaron also the same time.

And I took your sin, the calf which ye had made, and burnt it with fire, and stamped it, \add and\add* ground \add it\add* very small, \add even\add* until \add it was as\add* small as dust: and I cast the dust thereof into the brook that descended out of the mount.
And at Taberah, and at Massah, and at Kibroth-hattaavah, ye provoked the \sc Lord\sc* to wrath.

Likewise when the \sc Lord\sc* sent you from Kadesh-barnea, saying, Go up and possess the land which I have given you; then you rebelled against the commandment of the \sc Lord\sc* your God, and ye believed him not, nor hearkened to his voice.
You have been rebellious against the \sc Lord\sc* from the day that I knew you.
Thus I fell down before the \sc Lord\sc* forty days and forty nights, as I fell down \add at the first;\add* because the \sc Lord\sc* had said he would destroy you.

I prayed therefore unto the \sc Lord\sc*, and said, O Lord \sc God\sc*, destroy not thy people and thine inheritance, which thou hast redeemed through thy greatness, which thou hast brought forth out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
Remember thy servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; look not unto the stubbornness of this people, nor to their wickedness, nor to their sin:

lest the land whence thou broughtest us out say, Because the \sc Lord\sc* was not able to bring them into the land which he promised them, and because he hated them, he hath brought them out to slay them in the wilderness.
Yet they \add are\add* thy people and thine inheritance, which thou broughtest out by thy mighty power and by thy stretched out arm.
